alert.note: Alert for Clark; Taylor (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 27 at 5:25AM CST until February 27 at 6:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Freezing Rain This Morning... .Freezing rain is quickly surging northeast across the area early this morning, and will move north of highway 29 in north-central Wisconsin before 7 am. Untreated surfaces, including roads and sidewalks, will quickly accrue ice. Warmer air is also moving north, which will help limit the amount of freezing rain that will impact a location. Currently, warmer air is expected to reach the I-94 corridor by 8 am. Additional icing should end there, but surfaces could still be icy. North of there, freezing rain could persist for most of the morning. There will be a change over to snow for the afternoon north of highway 29 in north-central Wisconsin, with 1 to 2 inch accumulations. Temperatures will play a key role in icing amounts. Small changes could result in substantial shifts in impacts. Pay close attention to the forecast for any revisions. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Freezing rain this morning, transitioning to snow in the afternoon. Ice accumulations from 2 to 4 tenths of an inch. Snow accumulations of 1 to 2". Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Taylor and Clark Counties. * WHEN...Until 6 PM CST this evening. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are likely due to the ice. Travel could be nearly impossible. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning and evening commutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Visit 511wi.gov for road conditions.
